content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a way you might tackle this problem:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    lines = split(md, '\n')  # Split the markdown document into lines
    code_lines = String[]
    
    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, '```' ) || startswith(line, '```julia')
            push!(code_lines, "begin")
        elseif endswith(line, '```' ) || endswith(line, '```julia')
            push!(code_lines, "")
        elseif line != "" && code_lines[end] == "begin"
            code_lines[end] *= "\n" * line
        end 
    end
    
    # Remove the first and last lines if they're empty
    while isempty(code_lines[1]) 
        popfirst!(code_lines)
    end
    
    while isempty(code_lines[end]) 
        poplast!(code_lines)
    end
    
    join(code_lines, "\n") * "\n" # Join the lines into a single string with newlines between each line.
end
```
